reviews.text: The Hotel Erzsebet was not far from the Erzsebet bridge over the Danube, and a short walk to the metro station. Budapest metro makes it easy to get around, so the Erzsebet's location was quite convenient. Buffet breakfast had plenty of variety, but the food was a bit underwhelming for my palate.
reviews.title: Old world Hotel
Good hotel in good ocation
reviews.text: Hotel was reasonably priced and in a good location - within easy walking distance of city centre, market, Erzsebet Bridge, and pedestrianised tourist area.
Situated in a busy street, it can be noisy at the front, but by closing the windows, it minimised the noise considerably.
reviews.title: Excellent location, pleasant staff
Potential noise
reviews.text: For a 3+ star oversees hotel, it definitely is above average. Comfortable room and bed and all normal facilities (except tea and coffee in rooms).

reviews.title: A very nice, clean, affordable spot
reviews.text: Continental breakfast with good range of food - even had two hot choices.

reviews.title: Good location - good staff
reviews.text: We just stayed three nights at the Erzsebet. The location is convenient to the subway and just a block off of a pedestrian-only street with shopping and restaurants.

reviews.title: Lovely staff, great location x
reviews.text: The room was clean and modern (if a little small). Our room fronted on the street, and when we opened the window to cool the room down, the traffic noise was considerable.

reviews.title: good hotel,central location
reviews.text: The front desk staff was very efficient and helpful. No internet access in the rooms, but there is a free PC off the lobby with access.

reviews.title: Hotel Erzsebet
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was good - and the dining room was comfortable.
